title.text: RFC 5089: IS-IS Protocol Extensions for Path Computation Element (PCE) Discovery

contents.text:
Network Working Group                                   JL. Le Roux, Ed.
Request for Comments: 5089                                France Telecom
Category: Standards Track                               JP. Vasseur, Ed.
                                                       Cisco System Inc.
                                                              Y. Ikejiri
                                                      NTT Communications
                                                                R. Zhang
                                                                      BT
                                                            January 2008
IS-IS Protocol Extensions for Path Computation Element (PCE) Discovery
contents.zh-CHS: 用于路径计算元素（PCE）发现的IS-IS协议扩展

contents.text: Status of This Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 关于下段备忘

contents.text: This document specifies an Internet standards track protocol for the Internet community, and requests discussion and suggestions for improvements. Please refer to the current edition of the "Internet Official Protocol Standards" (STD 1) for the standardization state and status of this protocol. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定了互联网社区的互联网标准跟踪协议，并要求进行讨论和提出改进建议。有关本协议的标准化状态和状态，请参考当前版本的“互联网官方协议标准”（STD 1）。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: There are various circumstances where it is highly desirable for a Path Computation Client (PCC) to be able to dynamically and automatically discover a set of Path Computation Elements (PCEs), along with information that can be used by the PCC for PCE selection. When the PCE is a Label Switching Router (LSR) participating in the Interior Gateway Protocol (IGP), or even a server participating passively in the IGP, a simple and efficient way to announce PCEs consists of using IGP flooding. For that purpose, this document defines extensions to the Intermediate System to Intermediate System (IS-IS) routing protocol for the advertisement of PCE Discovery information within an IS-IS area or within the entire IS-IS routing domain.
contents.zh-CHS: 存在各种情况，其中路径计算客户端（PCC）能够动态且自动地发现一组路径计算元素（PCE）以及PCC可用于PCE选择的信息是非常期望的。当PCE是参与内部网关协议（IGP）的标签交换路由器（LSR），或者甚至是被动参与IGP的服务器时，宣布PCE的简单而有效的方法包括使用IGP泛洪。为此，本文档定义了中间系统到中间系统（IS-IS）路由协议的扩展，用于在IS-IS区域或整个IS-IS路由域内公布PCE发现信息。

contents.text: Table of Contents
contents.zh-CHS: 目录

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: [RFC4655] describes the motivations and architecture for a Path Computation Element (PCE)-based path computation model for Multi-Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) and Generalized MPLS (GMPLS) Traffic Engineered Label Switched Paths (TE LSPs). The model allows for the separation of the PCE from a Path Computation Client (PCC) (also referred to as a non co-located PCE) and allows for cooperation between PCEs (where one PCE acts as a PCC to make requests of the other PCE). This relies on a communication protocol between a PCC and PCE, and also between PCEs. The requirements for such a communication protocol can be found in [RFC4657], and the communication protocol is defined in [PCEP].
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC4655]描述了用于多协议标签交换（MPLS）和广义MPLS（GMPLS）流量工程标签交换路径（TE LSP）的基于路径计算元素（PCE）的路径计算模型的动机和体系结构。该模型允许将PCE与路径计算客户端（PCC）（也称为非同址PCE）分离，并允许PCE之间的合作（其中一个PCE充当PCC向另一个PCE发出请求）。这依赖于PCC和PCE之间以及PCE之间的通信协议。此类通信协议的要求见[RFC4657]，通信协议定义见[PCEP]。

contents.text: The PCE architecture requires that a PCC be aware of the location of one or more PCEs in its domain, and, potentially, of PCEs in other domains, e.g., in the case of inter-domain TE LSP computation.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE体系结构要求PCC知道其域中的一个或多个PCE的位置，并且可能知道其他域中的PCE的位置，例如，在域间TE LSP计算的情况下。

contents.text: A network may contain a large number of PCEs, each with potentially distinct capabilities. In such a context, it is highly desirable to have a mechanism for automatic and dynamic PCE discovery that allows PCCs to automatically discover a set of PCEs, along with additional information about each PCE that may be used by a PCC to perform PCE selection. Additionally, it is valuable for a PCC to dynamically detect new PCEs, failed PCEs, or any modification to the PCE information. Detailed requirements for such a PCE discovery mechanism are provided in [RFC4674].
contents.zh-CHS: 一个网络可能包含大量的PCE，每个PCE具有潜在的不同功能。在这样的上下文中，非常希望具有用于自动和动态PCE发现的机制，该机制允许PCC自动发现一组PCE，以及关于PCC可用于执行PCE选择的每个PCE的附加信息。此外，PCC动态检测新PCE、故障PCE或对PCE信息的任何修改是有价值的。[RFC4674]中提供了此类PCE发现机制的详细要求。

contents.text: Note that the PCE selection algorithm applied by a PCC is out of the scope of this document.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，PCC应用的PCE选择算法超出了本文档的范围。

contents.text: When PCCs are LSRs participating in the IGP (OSPF or IS-IS), and PCEs are either LSRs or servers also participating in the IGP, an effective mechanism for PCE discovery within an IGP routing domain consists of utilizing IGP advertisements.
contents.zh-CHS: 当pcc是参与IGP（OSPF或IS-IS）的lsr，并且PCE是也参与IGP的lsr或服务器时，IGP路由域内PCE发现的有效机制包括利用IGP广告。

contents.text: This document defines extensions to IS-IS [ISO] to allow a PCE in an IS-IS routing domain to advertise its location, along with some information useful to a PCC for PCE selection, so as to satisfy dynamic PCE discovery requirements set forth in [RFC4674].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了IS-IS[ISO]的扩展，以允许IS-IS路由域中的PCE公布其位置，以及一些对PCC选择PCE有用的信息，从而满足[RFC4674]中规定的动态PCE发现要求。

contents.text: Generic capability advertisement mechanisms for IS-IS are defined in [RFC4971]. These allow a router to advertise its capabilities within an IS-IS area or an entire IS-IS routing domain. This document leverages this generic capability advertisement mechanism to fully satisfy the dynamic PCE discovery requirements.
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS的通用能力公布机制在[RFC4971]中定义。这些允许路由器在IS-IS区域或整个IS-IS路由域内公布其功能。本文档利用此通用功能发布机制，完全满足动态PCE发现需求。

contents.text: This document defines a new sub-TLV (named the PCE Discovery (PCED)) to be carried within the IS-IS Router Capability TLV ([RFC4971]).
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了IS-IS路由器能力TLV（[RFC4971]）中携带的新子TLV（名为PCE发现（PCED））。

contents.text: The PCE information advertised is detailed in Section 3. Protocol extensions and procedures are defined in Sections 4 and 5.
contents.zh-CHS: 第3节详细介绍了公布的PCE信息。第4节和第5节定义了协议扩展和程序。

contents.text: The IS-IS extensions defined in this document allow for PCE discovery within an IS-IS routing domain. Solutions for PCE discovery across AS boundaries are beyond the scope of this document, and are for further study.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档中定义的IS-IS扩展允许在IS-IS路由域中发现PCE。跨越AS边界的PCE发现解决方案超出了本文档的范围，有待进一步研究。

contents.text: This document defines a set of sub-TLVs that are nested within each other. When the degree of nesting TLVs is 2 (a TLV is carried within another TLV) the TLV carried within a TLV is called a sub-TLV. Strictly speaking, when the degree of nesting is 3, a sub-sub-TLV is carried within a sub-TLV that is itself carried within a TLV. For the sake of terminology simplicity, a TLV carried within another TLV is called a sub-TLV regardless of the degree of nesting.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了一组相互嵌套的子TLV。当嵌套TLV的阶数为2（一个TLV包含在另一个TLV中）时，TLV中包含的TLV称为子TLV。严格来说，当嵌套度为3时，子TLV在子TLV中承载，而子TLV本身在TLV中承载。为了术语的简单性，在另一个TLV中携带的TLV称为子TLV，无论嵌套程度如何。

contents.text: 2. Terminology
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 术语

contents.text: ABR: IS-IS Area Border Router.
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS区域边界路由器。

contents.text: AS: Autonomous System.
contents.zh-CHS: AS：自治系统。

contents.text: IGP: Interior Gateway Protocol. Either of the two routing protocols, Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) or Intermediate System to Intermediate system (IS-IS).
contents.zh-CHS: IGP：内部网关协议。两种路由协议之一，开放最短路径优先（OSPF）或中间系统到中间系统（IS-IS）。

contents.text: Intra-area TE LSP: A TE LSP whose path does not cross an IGP area boundary.
contents.zh-CHS: 区域内TE LSP：路径不穿过IGP区域边界的TE LSP。

contents.text: Intra-AS TE LSP: A TE LSP whose path does not cross an AS boundary.
contents.zh-CHS: 内部AS TE LSP：路径不跨越AS边界的TE LSP。

contents.text: Inter-area TE LSP: A TE LSP whose path transits two or more IGP areas. That is, a TE LSP that crosses at least one IGP area boundary.
contents.zh-CHS: 区域间TE LSP：路径穿过两个或多个IGP区域的TE LSP。即，穿过至少一个IGP区域边界的TE LSP。

contents.text: Inter-AS TE LSP: A TE LSP whose path transits two or more ASes or sub-ASes (BGP confederations). That is, a TE LSP that crosses at least one AS boundary.
contents.zh-CHS: 内部AS TE LSP：路径通过两个或多个ASE或子ASE（BGP联盟）的TE LSP。即，跨越至少一个AS边界的TE LSP。

contents.text: IS-IS LSP: Link State PDU.
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS LSP：链路状态PDU。

contents.text: LSR: Label Switching Router.
contents.zh-CHS: 标签交换路由器。

contents.text: PCC: Path Computation Client. Any client application requesting a path computation to be performed by a Path Computation Element.
contents.zh-CHS: 路径计算客户端。任何请求由路径计算元素执行的路径计算的客户端应用程序。

contents.text: PCE: Path Computation Element. An entity (component, application, or network node) that is capable of computing a network path or route based on a network graph and applying computational constraints.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE：路径计算元素。能够基于网络图计算网络路径或路由并应用计算约束的实体（组件、应用程序或网络节点）。

contents.text: PCED: PCE Discovery.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE：PCE发现。

contents.text: PCE-Domain: In a PCE context, this refers to any collection of network elements within a common sphere of address management or path computational responsibility (referred to as a "domain" in [RFC4655]). Examples of PCE-Domains include IGP areas and ASes. This should be distinguished from an IS-IS routing domain as defined by [ISO].
contents.zh-CHS: PCE域：在PCE上下文中，这是指地址管理或路径计算责任（在[RFC4655]中称为“域”）的公共范围内的任何网络元素集合。PCE结构域的示例包括IGP区域和ASE。这应区别于[ISO]定义的IS-IS路由域。

contents.text: PCEP: Path Computation Element communication Protocol.
contents.zh-CHS: PCEP：路径计算元素通信协议。

contents.text: TE LSP: Traffic Engineered Label Switched Path.
contents.zh-CHS: TE LSP：流量工程标签交换路径。

contents.text: TLV: Type-Length-Variable data encoding.
contents.zh-CHS: TLV：类型长度变量数据编码。

contents.text: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in [RFC2119].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中的关键词“必须”、“不得”、“必需”、“应”、“不应”、“应”、“不应”、“建议”、“可”和“可选”应按照[RFC2119]中所述进行解释。

contents.text: 3. Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 概述

contents.text: 3.1. PCE Discovery Information
contents.zh-CHS: 3.1. PCE发现信息

contents.text: The PCE discovery information is composed of:
contents.zh-CHS: PCE发现信息由以下部分组成：

contents.text: - The PCE location: an IPv4 and/or IPv6 address that is used to reach the PCE. It is RECOMMENDED to use an address that is always reachable if there is any connectivity to the PCE;
contents.zh-CHS: - PCE位置：用于到达PCE的IPv4和/或IPv6地址。如果与PCE有任何连接，建议使用始终可访问的地址；

contents.text: - The PCE path computation scope (i.e., intra-layer, inter-area, inter-AS, or inter-layer);
contents.zh-CHS: - PCE路径计算范围（即层内、区域间、AS间或层间）；

contents.text: - The set of one or more PCE-Domain(s) into which the PCE has visibility and for which the PCE can compute paths;
contents.zh-CHS: - 一个或多个PCE域的集合，其中PCE具有可见性并且PCE可以为其计算路径；

contents.text: - The set of zero, one, or more neighbor PCE-Domain(s) toward which the PCE can compute paths;
contents.zh-CHS: - 零个、一个或多个相邻PCE域的集合，PCE可向其计算路径；

contents.text: - A set of communication capabilities (e.g., support for request prioritization) and path computation-specific capabilities (e.g., supported constraints).
contents.zh-CHS: - 一组通信能力（例如，支持请求优先级）和路径计算特定能力（例如，支持的约束）。

contents.text: PCE discovery information is, by nature, fairly static and does not change with PCE activity. Changes in PCE discovery information may occur as a result of PCE configuration updates, PCE deployment/activation, PCE deactivation/suppression, or PCE failure. Hence, this information is not expected to change frequently.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE发现信息本质上是静态的，不随PCE活动而变化。PCE发现信息的更改可能是PCE配置更新、PCE部署/激活、PCE停用/抑制或PCE故障的结果。因此，该信息预计不会经常更改。

contents.text: 3.2. Flooding Scope
contents.zh-CHS: 3.2. 泛洪范围

contents.text: The flooding scope for PCE information advertised through IS-IS can be a single L1 area, an L1 area and the L2 sub-domain, or the entire IS-IS routing domain.
contents.zh-CHS: 通过IS-IS公布的PCE信息的泛洪范围可以是单个L1区域、L1区域和L2子域，或者整个IS-IS路由域。

contents.text: 4. The IS-IS PCED Sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 4. IS-IS PCED子TLV

contents.text: The IS-IS PCED sub-TLV contains a non-ordered set of sub-TLVs.
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS PCED子TLV包含一组非有序子TLV。

contents.text: The format of the IS-IS PCED sub-TLV and its sub-TLVs is identical to the TLV format used by the Traffic Engineering Extensions to IS-IS [RFC3784]. That is, the TLV is comprised of 1 octet for the type, 1 octet specifying the TLV length, and a value field. The Length field defines the length of the value portion in octets.
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS PCED子TLV及其子TLV的格式与IS-IS[RFC3784]交通工程扩展使用的TLV格式相同。也就是说，TLV由类型的1个八位字节、指定TLV长度的1个八位字节和一个值字段组成。长度字段定义值部分的长度（以八位字节为单位）。

contents.text: The IS-IS PCED sub-TLV has the following format:
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS PCED子TLV具有以下格式：

contents.text: TYPE: 5 LENGTH: Variable VALUE: Set of sub-TLVs
contents.zh-CHS: 类型：5长度：变量值：子TLV集

contents.text: Five sub-TLVs are defined:
contents.zh-CHS: 定义了五个子TLV：

contents.text: Sub-TLV type Length Name 1 variable PCE-ADDRESS sub-TLV 2 3 PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV 3 variable PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV 4 variable NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV 5 variable PCE-CAP-FLAGS sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 子TLV类型长度名称1变量PCE地址子TLV 2 3路径范围子TLV 3变量PCE域子TLV 4变量NEIG-PCE域子TLV 5变量PCE-CAP-FLAGS子TLV

contents.text: The PCE-ADDRESS and PATH-SCOPE sub-TLVs MUST always be present within the PCED sub-TLV.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE地址和路径范围子TLV必须始终存在于PCE子TLV中。

contents.text: The PCE-DOMAIN and NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLVs are optional. They MAY be present in the PCED sub-TLV to facilitate selection of inter-domain PCEs.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE域和NEIG-PCE域子TLV是可选的。它们可能存在于PCED子TLV中，以促进域间PCE的选择。

contents.text: The PCE-CAP-FLAGS sub-TLV is optional and MAY be present in the PCED sub-TLV to facilitate the PCE selection process.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE-CAP-FLAGS子TLV是可选的，可存在于PCE子TLV中，以促进PCE选择过程。

contents.text: Any unrecognized sub-TLV MUST be silently ignored.
contents.zh-CHS: 任何无法识别的子TLV都必须以静默方式忽略。

contents.text: The PCED sub-TLV is carried within an IS-IS CAPABILITY TLV defined in [RFC4971].
contents.zh-CHS: PCED子TLV在[RFC4971]中定义的is-is能力TLV内携带。

contents.text: No additional sub-TLVs will be added to the PCED TLV in the future. If a future application requires the advertisement of additional PCE information in IS-IS, this will not be carried in the CAPABILITY TLV.
contents.zh-CHS: 未来不会向PCED TLV添加额外的子TLV。如果未来的应用需要在IS-IS中公布额外的PCE信息，则不会在能力TLV中进行。

contents.text: The following sub-sections describe the sub-TLVs that may be carried within the PCED sub-TLV.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下小节描述了PCED子TLV内可能携带的子TLV。

contents.text: 4.1. PCE-ADDRESS Sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 4.1. PCE地址子TLV

contents.text: The PCE-ADDRESS sub-TLV specifies an IP address that can be used to reach the PCE. It is RECOMMENDED to make use of an address that is always reachable, provided the PCE is alive and reachable.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE-ADDRESS子TLV指定可用于访问PCE的IP地址。建议使用始终可访问的地址，前提是PCE处于活动状态且可访问。

contents.text: The PCE-ADDRESS sub-TLV is mandatory; it MUST be present within the PCED sub-TLV. It MAY appear twice, when the PCE has both an IPv4 and IPv6 address. It MUST NOT appear more than once for the same address type. If it appears more than once for the same address type, only the first occurrence is processed and any others MUST be ignored.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE地址子TLV是强制性的；它必须存在于PCED子TLV内。当PCE同时具有IPv4和IPv6地址时，它可能会出现两次。对于同一地址类型，它不能出现多次。如果同一地址类型多次出现，则只处理第一次出现的内容，而必须忽略任何其他内容。

contents.text: The PCE-ADDRESS sub-TLV has the following format:
contents.zh-CHS: PCE地址子TLV具有以下格式：

contents.text: TYPE: 1 LENGTH: 5 for an IPv4 address or 17 for an IPv6 address. VALUE: This comprises one octet indicating the address-type and 4 or 16 octets encoding the IPv4 or IPv6 address to be used to reach the PCE.
contents.zh-CHS: 类型：1长度：IPv4地址为5，IPv6地址为17。值：这包括一个表示地址类型的八位字节和4或16个编码用于到达PCE的IPv4或IPv6地址的八位字节。

contents.text: Address-type: 1 IPv4 2 IPv6
contents.zh-CHS: 地址类型：1 IPv4 2 IPv6

contents.text: 4.2. The PATH-SCOPE Sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2. 路径范围子TLV

contents.text: The PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV indicates the PCE path computation scope, which refers to the PCE's ability to compute or take part in the computation of paths for intra-area, inter-area, inter-AS, or inter-layer TE LSPs.
contents.zh-CHS: PATH-SCOPE子TLV指示PCE路径计算范围，其指PCE计算或参与区域内、区域间、AS间或层间TE LSP的路径计算的能力。

contents.text: The PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV is mandatory; it MUST be present within the PCED sub-TLV. There MUST be exactly one instance of the PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV within each PCED sub-TLV. If it appears more than once only the first occurrence is processed and any others MUST be ignored.
contents.zh-CHS: 路径范围子TLV是强制性的；它必须存在于PCED子TLV内。在每个PCED子TLV中必须恰好有一个PATH-SCOPE子TLV实例。如果多次出现，则只处理第一次出现的内容，并且必须忽略任何其他内容。

contents.text: The PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV contains a set of bit flags indicating the supported path scopes, and four fields indicating PCE preferences.
contents.zh-CHS: PATH-SCOPE子TLV包含一组指示支持的路径范围的位标志，以及四个指示PCE首选项的字段。

contents.text: The PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV has the following format:
contents.zh-CHS: PATH-SCOPE子TLV具有以下格式：

contents.text: TYPE: 2 LENGTH: 3 VALUE: This comprises a 1-octet flags field where each flag represents a supported path scope, followed by a 2-octet preferences field indicating PCE preferences.
contents.zh-CHS: 类型：2长度：3值：这包括一个1八位组标志字段，其中每个标志表示支持的路径范围，后面是一个2八位组首选项字段，指示PCE首选项。

contents.text: Here is the structure of the flags field:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下是flags字段的结构：

contents.text: Bit Path Scope
contents.zh-CHS: 位路径范围

contents.text: 0 L bit: Can compute intra-area paths. 1 R bit: Can act as PCE for inter-area TE LSP computation. 2 Rd bit: Can act as a default PCE for inter-area TE LSP computation. 3 S bit: Can act as PCE for inter-AS TE LSP computation. 4 Sd bit: Can act as a default PCE for inter-AS TE LSP computation. 5 Y bit: Can act as PCE for inter-layer TE LSP computation. 6-7 Reserved for future use.
contents.zh-CHS: 0 L位：可以计算区域内路径。1 R位：可用作区域间TE LSP计算的PCE。第2位：可作为区域间TE LSP计算的默认PCE。3s位：可作为PCE用于内部as TE LSP计算。4 Sd位：可作为as TE LSP计算的默认PCE。5Y位：可作为层间TE LSP计算的PCE。6-7保留供将来使用。

contents.text: Here is the structure of the preferences field:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下是首选项字段的结构：

contents.text: PrefL field: PCE's preference for intra-area TE LSP computation.
contents.zh-CHS: PrefL字段：PCE对区域内TE LSP计算的偏好。

contents.text: PrefR field: PCE's preference for inter-area TE LSP computation.
contents.zh-CHS: PrefR字段：PCE对区域间TE LSP计算的偏好。

contents.text: PrefS field: PCE's preference for inter-AS TE LSP computation.
contents.zh-CHS: PrefS字段：PCE对内部AS TE LSP计算的偏好。

contents.text: Pref-Y field: PCE's preference for inter-layer TE LSP computation.
contents.zh-CHS: Pref-Y字段：PCE对层间TE LSP计算的偏好。

contents.text: Res: Reserved for future use.
contents.zh-CHS: Res：保留供将来使用。

contents.text: The L, R, S, and Y bits are set when the PCE can act as a PCE for intra-area, inter-area, inter-AS, or inter-layer TE LSP computation, respectively. These bits are non-exclusive.
contents.zh-CHS: 当PCE可以分别作为用于区域内、区域间、as间或层间TE LSP计算的PCE时，设置L、R、S和Y比特。这些位是非独占的。

contents.text: When set, the Rd bit indicates that the PCE can act as a default PCE for inter-area TE LSP computation (that is, the PCE can compute a path toward any neighbor area). Similarly, when set, the Sd bit indicates that the PCE can act as a default PCE for inter-AS TE LSP computation (the PCE can compute a path toward any neighbor AS).
contents.zh-CHS: 当设置时，Rd位指示PCE可以充当用于区域间TE LSP计算的默认PCE（即，PCE可以计算到任何相邻区域的路径）。类似地，当设置时，Sd位指示PCE可以充当as-TE-LSP计算的默认PCE（PCE可以计算到任何相邻as的路径）。

contents.text: When the Rd and Sd bit are set, the PCED sub-TLV MUST NOT contain a NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV (see Section 4.4).
contents.zh-CHS: 设置Rd和Sd位时，PCED子TLV不得包含NEIG-PCE域子TLV（见第4.4节）。

contents.text: When the R bit is clear, the Rd bit SHOULD be clear on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt. When the S bit is clear, the Sd bit SHOULD be clear on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt.
contents.zh-CHS: 当R位清除时，Rd位在传输时应清除，在接收时必须忽略。当S位清除时，Sd位在传输时应清除，在接收时必须忽略。

contents.text: The PrefL, PrefR, PrefS and PrefY fields are each three bits long and allow the PCE to specify a preference for each computation scope,
contents.zh-CHS: PrefL、PrefR、PrefS和PrefY字段的长度均为三位，允许PCE为每个计算范围指定首选项，

contents.text: where 7 reflects the highest preference. Such preferences can be used for weighted load balancing of path computation requests. An operator may decide to configure a preference for each computation scope at each PCE so as to balance the path computation load among them. The algorithms used by a PCC to balance its path computation requests according to such PCE preferences are out of the scope of this document and are a matter for local or network-wide policy. The same or different preferences may be used for each scope. For instance, an operator that wants a PCE capable of both inter-area and inter-AS computation to be preferred for use for inter-AS computations may configure PrefS higher than PrefR.
contents.zh-CHS: 其中7表示最高偏好。这样的首选项可用于路径计算请求的加权负载平衡。操作员可以决定在每个PCE处为每个计算范围配置偏好，以便平衡它们之间的路径计算负载。PCC根据此类PCE首选项平衡其路径计算请求所使用的算法不在本文档的范围内，属于本地或网络范围内的政策问题。每个作用域可以使用相同或不同的首选项。例如，希望能够同时进行区域间和区域间AS计算的PCE优先用于区域间AS计算的运营商可以将PREF配置为高于PrefR。

contents.text: When the L, R, S, or Y bits are cleared, the PrefL, PrefR, PrefS, and PrefY fields SHOULD respectively be set to 0 on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt.
contents.zh-CHS: 清除L、R、S或Y位时，传输时应将PrefL、PrefR、PrefS和PrefY字段分别设置为0，接收时必须忽略。

contents.text: Both reserved fields SHOULD be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt.
contents.zh-CHS: 两个保留字段在传输时都应设置为零，在接收时必须忽略。

contents.text: 4.3. PCE-DOMAIN Sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 4.3. PCE域子TLV

contents.text: The PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV specifies a PCE-Domain (area and/or AS) where the PCE has topology visibility and through which the PCE can compute paths.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE-DOMAIN子TLV指定PCE具有拓扑可见性的PCE域（区域和/或AS），PCE可以通过该域计算路径。

contents.text: The PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV SHOULD be present when PCE-Domains for which the PCE can operate cannot be inferred by other IGP information: for instance, when the PCE is inter-domain capable (i.e., when the R bit or S bit is set) and the flooding scope is the entire routing domain (see Section 5 for a discussion of how the flooding scope is set and interpreted).
contents.zh-CHS: 当PCE可操作的PCE域不能由其他IGP信息推断时，应存在PCE域子TLV：例如，当PCE具有域间能力（即，设置了R位或S位）且泛洪范围为整个路由域时（有关如何设置和解释洪水范围的讨论，请参见第5节）。

contents.text: A PCED sub-TLV may include multiple PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLVs when the PCE has visibility into multiple PCE-Domains.
contents.zh-CHS: 当PCE可以看到多个PCE域时，PCE子TLV可以包括多个PCE域子TLV。

contents.text: The PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV has the following format:
contents.zh-CHS: PCE域子TLV具有以下格式：

contents.text: TYPE: 3 LENGTH: Variable VALUE: This is composed of one octet indicating the domain-type (area ID or AS Number) and a variable length IS-IS area ID or a 32-bit AS number, identifying a PCE-Domain where the PCE has visibility and can compute paths.
contents.zh-CHS: 类型：3长度：变量值：它由一个八位字节组成，表示域类型（区域ID或AS编号）和一个可变长度is-is区域ID或32位AS编号，用于标识PCE具有可见性且可以计算路径的PCE域。

contents.text: Two domain types are defined:
contents.zh-CHS: 定义了两种域类型：

contents.text: 1 Area ID 2 AS Number
contents.zh-CHS: 1区域ID 2作为编号

contents.text: The Area ID is the area address as defined in [ISO].
contents.zh-CHS: 区域ID是[ISO]中定义的区域地址。

contents.text: When the AS number is coded in two octets, the AS Number field MUST have its first two octets set to 0.
contents.zh-CHS: 当AS编号编码为两个八位字节时，AS编号字段的前两个八位字节必须设置为0。

contents.text: 4.4. NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN Sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4. NEIG-PCE域子TLV

contents.text: The NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV specifies a neighbor PCE-Domain (area or AS) toward which a PCE can compute paths. It means that the PCE can take part in the computation of inter-domain TE LSPs with paths that transit this neighbor PCE-Domain.
contents.zh-CHS: NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN子TLV指定PCE可以计算路径的相邻PCE域（区域或AS）。这意味着PCE可以参与域间TE LSP的计算，其路径通过该相邻PCE域。

contents.text: A PCED sub-TLV may include several NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLVs when the PCE can compute paths towards several neighbor PCE-Domains.
contents.zh-CHS: 当PCE可以计算到多个相邻PCE域的路径时，PCE子TLV可以包括多个NEIG-PCE域子TLV。

contents.text: The NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV has the same format as the PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV:
contents.zh-CHS: NEIG-PCE域子TLV与PCE域子TLV的格式相同：

contents.text: TYPE: 4 LENGTH: Variable VALUE: This comprises one octet indicating the domain-type (area ID or AS Number) and a variable length IS-IS area ID or a 32-bit AS number, identifying a PCE-Domain toward which the PCE can compute paths.
contents.zh-CHS: 类型：4长度：可变值：它包括一个八位字节，表示域类型（区域ID或AS编号）和一个可变长度IS-IS区域ID或32位AS编号，标识PCE可以计算路径的PCE域。

contents.text: Two domain types are defined:
contents.zh-CHS: 定义了两种域类型：

contents.text: 1 Area ID 2 AS Number
contents.zh-CHS: 1区域ID 2作为编号

contents.text: The Area ID is the area address as defined in [ISO].
contents.zh-CHS: 区域ID是[ISO]中定义的区域地址。

contents.text: When the AS number is coded in two octets, the AS Number field MUST have its first two octets set to 0.
contents.zh-CHS: 当AS编号编码为两个八位字节时，AS编号字段的前两个八位字节必须设置为0。

contents.text: The NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN sub-TLV MUST be present at least once with domain-type set to 1 if the R bit is set and the Rd bit is cleared, and MUST be present at least once with domain-type set to 2 if the S bit is set and the Sd bit is cleared.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果设置了R位且清除了Rd位，则NEIG-PCE-DOMAIN子TLV必须在域类型设置为1时至少出现一次，如果设置了S位且清除了Sd位，则必须在域类型设置为2时至少出现一次。

contents.text: 4.5. PCE-CAP-FLAGS Sub-TLV
contents.zh-CHS: 4.5. PCE-CAP-FLAGS子TLV

contents.text: The PCE-CAP-FLAGS sub-TLV is an optional sub-TLV used to indicate PCE capabilities. It MAY be present within the PCED sub-TLV. It MUST NOT be present more than once. If it appears more than once, only the first occurrence is processed and any others MUST be ignored.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE-CAP-FLAGS子TLV是用于指示PCE能力的可选子TLV。它可能存在于PCED子TLV中。它不能出现超过一次。如果它出现多次，则只处理第一次出现的内容，而必须忽略任何其他内容。

contents.text: The value field of the PCE-CAP-FLAGS sub-TLV is made up of an array of units of 32-bit flags numbered from the most significant bit as bit zero, where each bit represents one PCE capability.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE-CAP-FLAGS子TLV的值字段由一组32位标志组成，这些标志从最高有效位开始编号为零位，其中每个位表示一个PCE能力。

contents.text: The PCE-CAP-FLAGS sub-TLV has the following format:
contents.zh-CHS: PCE-CAP-FLAGS子TLV具有以下格式：

contents.text: TYPE: 5 LENGTH: Multiple of 4 VALUE: This contains an array of units of 32-bit flags numbered from the most significant as bit zero, where each bit represents one PCE capability.
contents.zh-CHS: 类型：5长度：4值的倍数：包含32位标志的单元数组，从最高有效位开始编号为零位，其中每个位表示一个PCE功能。

contents.text: The PCE capability registry is managed by IANA; it is common with OSPF and defined in [RFC5088].
contents.zh-CHS: PCE能力注册表由IANA管理；它与OSPF通用，并在[RFC5088]中定义。

contents.text: Reserved bits SHOULD be set to zero on transmission and MUST be ignored on receipt.
contents.zh-CHS: 保留位在传输时应设置为零，在接收时必须忽略。

contents.text: 5. Elements of Procedure
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 程序要素

contents.text: The PCED sub-TLV is advertised within an IS-IS Router Capability TLV defined in [RFC4971]. As such, elements of procedures are inherited from those defined in [RFC4971].
contents.zh-CHS: PCED子TLV在[RFC4971]中定义的is-is路由器能力TLV内公布。因此，程序元素继承自[RFC4971]中定义的元素。

contents.text: The flooding scope is controlled by the S flag in the IS-IS Router Capability TLV (see [RFC4971]). When the scope of the PCED sub-TLV is area local, it MUST be carried within an IS-IS Router Capability TLV having the S bit cleared. When the scope of the PCED sub-TLV is the entire IS-IS routing domain, it MUST be carried within an IS-IS Router Capability TLV having the S bit set. Note that when only the L bit of the PATH-SCOPE sub-TLV is set, the flooding scope MUST be area local.
contents.zh-CHS: 泛洪范围由is-is路由器功能TLV中的S标志控制（请参见[RFC4971]）。当PCED子TLV的范围为区域本地时，它必须在S位清除的is-is路由器能力TLV内携带。当PCED子TLV的范围是整个is-is路由域时，它必须携带在具有S位设置的is-is路由器能力TLV内。请注意，当仅设置PATH-SCOPE子TLV的L位时，泛洪范围必须为区域本地。

contents.text: Note that an L1L2 node may include a PCED TLV in a Router Capability TLV with the S bit cleared in both in its L1 and L2 LSPs. This allows the flooding scope to be restricted to the L1 area and the L2 sub-domain.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意，L1L2节点可以在其L1和L2 lsp中都清除S位的路由器能力TLV中包括PCED TLV。这允许泛洪范围限制在L1区域和L2子域。

contents.text: When the PCE function is deactivated, the IS-IS speaker advertising this PCE MUST originate a new IS-IS LSP that no longer includes the corresponding PCED TLV.
contents.zh-CHS: 当PCE功能停用时，播发此PCE的is-is扬声器必须发出一个新的is-is LSP，该LSP不再包括相应的PCED TLV。

contents.text: The PCE address (i.e., the address indicated within the PCE-ADDRESS sub-TLV) SHOULD be reachable via some prefixes advertised by IS-IS.
contents.zh-CHS: PCE地址（即PCE-address子TLV中指示的地址）应可通过IS-IS公布的一些前缀访问。

contents.text: The PCED sub-TLV information regarding a specific PCE is only considered current and useable when the router advertising this
contents.zh-CHS: 只有当路由器发布此信息时，才认为与特定PCE相关的PCED子TLV信息是当前的和可用的

contents.text: information is itself reachable via IS-IS calculated paths at the level of the LSP in which the PCED sub-TLV appears.
contents.zh-CHS: 信息本身可通过出现PCED子TLV的LSP级别的is-is计算路径访问。

contents.text: A change in the state of a PCE (activate, deactivate, parameter change) MUST result in a corresponding change in the PCED sub-TLV information advertised by an IS-IS router (inserted, removed, updated) in its LSP. The way PCEs determine the information they advertise, and how that information is made available to IS-IS, is out of the scope of this document. Some information may be configured (e.g., address, preferences, scope) and other information may be automatically determined by the PCE (e.g., areas of visibility).
contents.zh-CHS: PCE状态的变化（激活、停用、参数变化）必须导致IS-IS路由器在其LSP中公布的PCE子TLV信息（插入、移除、更新）发生相应变化。PCE确定其发布信息的方式，以及该信息如何提供给is-is，不在本文档的范围内。一些信息可以配置（例如，地址、偏好、范围），其他信息可以由PCE自动确定（例如，可视区域）。

contents.text: A change in information in the PCED sub-TLV MUST NOT trigger any SPF computation at a receiving router.
contents.zh-CHS: PCED子TLV中的信息变化不得触发接收路由器上的任何SPF计算。

contents.text: 6. Backward Compatibility
contents.zh-CHS: 6. 向后兼容性

contents.text: The PCED sub-TLV defined in this document does not introduce any interoperability issues.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中定义的PCED子TLV不引入任何互操作性问题。

contents.text: An IS-IS router not supporting the PCED sub-TLV will just silently ignore the sub-TLV as specified in [RFC4971].
contents.zh-CHS: 不支持PCED子TLV的IS-IS路由器将按照[RFC4971]中的规定默默忽略子TLV。

contents.text: 7. IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 7. IANA考虑

contents.text: IANA has defined a registry for the sub-TLVs carried in the IS-IS Router Capability TLV defined in [RFC4971]. IANA has assigned a new sub-TLV codepoint for the PCED sub-TLV carried within the Router Capability TLV.
contents.zh-CHS: IANA已经为[RFC4971]中定义的IS-IS路由器能力TLV中所携带的子TLV定义了一个注册表。IANA已为路由器能力TLV内携带的PCED子TLV分配了一个新的子TLV码点。

contents.text:
Value      Sub-TLV                   References
-----     --------                   ----------
  5       PCED sub-TLV              (this document)
8. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 8. 安全考虑

contents.text: This document defines IS-IS extensions for PCE discovery within an administrative domain. Hence the security of the PCE discovery relies on the security of IS-IS.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档定义了管理域内PCE发现的IS-IS扩展。因此，PCE发现的安全性依赖于IS-IS的安全性。

contents.text: Mechanisms defined to ensure authenticity and integrity of IS-IS LSPs [RFC3567] and their TLVs, can be used to secure the PCED sub-TLV as well.
contents.zh-CHS: 为确保IS-IS LSP[RFC3567]及其TLV的真实性和完整性而定义的机制也可用于保护PCED子TLV。

contents.text: IS-IS provides no encryption mechanism for protecting the privacy of LSPs and, in particular, the privacy of the PCE discovery information.
contents.zh-CHS: IS-IS不提供加密机制来保护LSP的隐私，尤其是PCE发现信息的隐私。

contents.text: 9. Manageability Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 9. 可管理性考虑

contents.text: Manageability considerations for PCE Discovery are addressed in Section 4.10 of [RFC4674].
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC4674]第4.10节介绍了PCE发现的可管理性注意事项。

contents.text: 9.1. Control of Policy and Functions
contents.zh-CHS: 9.1. 政策和职能的控制

contents.text: Requirements for the configuration of PCE discovery parameters on PCCs and PCEs are discussed in Section 4.10.1 of [RFC4674].
contents.zh-CHS: [RFC4674]第4.10.1节讨论了PCC和PCE上PCE发现参数的配置要求。

contents.text: In particular, a PCE implementation SHOULD allow the following parameters to be configured on the PCE:
contents.zh-CHS: 具体而言，PCE实现应允许在PCE上配置以下参数：

contents.text: -The PCE IPv4/IPv6 address(es) (see Section 4.1).
contents.zh-CHS: -PCE IPv4/IPv6地址（见第4.1节）。

contents.text: -The PCE Scope, including the inter-domain functions (inter-area, inter-AS, inter-layer), the preferences, and whether the PCE can act as default PCE (see Section 4.2).
contents.zh-CHS: -PCE范围，包括域间功能（区域间、AS间、层间）、首选项以及PCE是否可以作为默认PCE（见第4.2节）。

contents.text: -The PCE-Domains (see Section 4.3).
contents.zh-CHS: -PCE领域（见第4.3节）。

contents.text: -The neighbor PCE-Domains (see Section 4.4).
contents.zh-CHS: -相邻的PCE域（见第4.4节）。

contents.text: -The PCE capabilities (see Section 4.5).
contents.zh-CHS: -PCE能力（见第4.5节）。

contents.text: 9.2. Information and Data Model
contents.zh-CHS: 9.2. 信息和数据模型

contents.text: A MIB module for PCE Discovery is defined in [PCED-MIB].
contents.zh-CHS: 用于PCE发现的MIB模块在[PCED-MIB]中定义。

contents.text: 9.3. Liveness Detection and Monitoring
contents.zh-CHS: 9.3. 活性检测与监测

contents.text: This document specifies the use of IS-IS as a PCE Discovery Protocol. The requirements specified in [RFC4674] include the ability to determine liveness of the PCE Discovery protocol. Normal operation of the IS-IS protocol meets these requirements.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档规定了IS-IS作为PCE发现协议的使用。[RFC4674]中规定的要求包括确定PCE发现协议活性的能力。IS-IS协议的正常运行符合这些要求。

contents.text: 9.4. Verify Correct Operations
contents.zh-CHS: 9.4. 验证操作是否正确

contents.text: The correlation of information advertised against information received can be achieved by comparing the information in the PCED sub-TLV received by the PCC with that stored at the PCE using the PCED MIB [PCED-MIB]. The number of dropped, corrupt, and rejected information elements are available through the PCED MIB.
contents.zh-CHS: 通过将PCC接收的PCED子TLV中的信息与使用PCED MIB[PCED-MIB]存储在PCE中的信息进行比较，可以实现广告信息与接收到的信息的相关性。丢弃、损坏和拒绝的信息元素的数量可通过PCED MIB获得。

contents.text: 9.5. Requirements on Other Protocols and Functional Components
contents.zh-CHS: 9.5. 对其他协议和功能组件的要求

contents.text: The IS-IS extensions defined in this document do not imply any requirements on other protocols.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中定义的IS-IS扩展并不意味着对其他协议有任何要求。

contents.text: 9.6. Impact on Network Operations
contents.zh-CHS: 9.6. 对网络运营的影响

contents.text: Frequent changes in PCE information advertised in the PCED sub-TLV may have a significant impact on IS-IS and might destabilize the operation of the network by causing the PCCs to swap between PCEs.
contents.zh-CHS: PCED子TLV中公布的PCE信息的频繁变化可能会对IS-IS产生重大影响，并可能导致PCC在PCE之间交换，从而破坏网络的运行。

contents.text: As discussed in Section 4.10.4 of [RFC4674], it MUST be possible to apply at least the following controls:
contents.zh-CHS: 如[RFC4674]第4.10.4节所述，必须能够至少应用以下控制：

contents.text: - Configurable limit on the rate of announcement of changed parameters at a PCE.
contents.zh-CHS: - 在PCE上公布更改参数的速率的可配置限制。

contents.text: - Control of the impact on PCCs, such as through rate-limiting the processing of PCED sub-TLVs.
contents.zh-CHS: - 控制对PCC的影响，例如通过限制PCED子TLV的处理速率。

contents.text: - Configurable control of triggers that cause a PCC to swap to another PCE.
contents.zh-CHS: - 可配置触发器控制，使PCC交换到另一个PCE。

contents.text: 10. Acknowledgments
contents.zh-CHS: 10. 致谢

contents.text: We would like to thank Lucy Wong, Adrian Farrel, Les Ginsberg, Mike Shand, Lou Berger, David Ward, Ross Callon, and Lisa Dusseault for their useful comments and suggestions.
contents.zh-CHS: 我们要感谢Lucy Wong、Adrian Farrel、Les Ginsberg、Mike Shand、Lou Berger、David Ward、Ross Callon和Lisa Dusseault提出的有用意见和建议。

contents.text: 11. References
contents.zh-CHS: 11. 工具书类

contents.text: 11.1. Normative References
contents.zh-CHS: 11.1. 规范性引用文件

contents.text: [ISO] "Intermediate System to Intermediate System Intra-Domain Routeing Exchange Protocol for use in Conjunction with the Protocol for Providing the Connectionless-mode Network Service" ISO/IEC 10589:2002 Second Edition.
contents.zh-CHS: [ISO]“与提供无连接模式网络服务的协议一起使用的中间系统到中间系统域内路由交换协议”ISO/IEC 10589:2002第二版。

contents.text: Copies of IPR disclosures made to the IETF Secretariat and any assurances of licenses to be made available, or the result of an attempt made to obtain a general license or permission for the use of such proprietary rights by implementers or users of this specification can be obtained from the IETF on-line IPR repository at http://www.ietf.org/ipr.

contents.text: The IETF invites any interested party to bring to its attention any copyrights, patents or patent applications, or other proprietary rights that may cover technology that may be required to implement this standard. Please address the information to the IETF at ietf-ipr@ietf.org.
